intro: Rhynchospora globosa var. globosa, commonly known as the globular spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, globular inflorescence composed of numerous small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, typically growing in dense clumps. This species thrives in moist, acidic soils and plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems.
